title: Anything she can do! Rob Kardashian hits the gym in bid to lose pounds as on-off fiancée Blac Chyna shares impressive weight loss
content:
His ex Blac Chyna flaunted her post-pregnancy weight loss with a sexy photo shoot this week.And it looks like Rob Kardashian's been on a bit of an exercise kick too, with a jog on Monday and a trip to the gym on Wednesday.The father-of-one posted an Instagram photo of a long G-Series mat lined with various forms of workout equipment, beneath a ceiling covered in framed sports jerseys.



'Got it in': Rob Kardashian hit the gym on Wednesday, the same day ex Blac Chyna revealed her impressive weight loss 



Health kick: Earlier on Wednesday, the plump only son of Kris Jenner seemed to show a commitment to fitness, uploading an Instagram photo of his Pressed juiceRob uploaded his gym photo with the caption: 'Got it in with @gunnarfitness' tagging Gunnar Peterson, a favorite personal trainer of his sisters Kim and Khloe as well as stars like Sofia Vergara and Sylvester Stallone.Earlier on Wednesday, the only son of Kris Jenner seemed to show a commitment to fitness, uploading an Instagram photo of his Pressed juice.He was standing by a swimming pool, holding the bottle before the camera for a picture with a caption that crowed it was 'Green juice time'.



Heavy: Rob, pictured with fiancee Blac Chyna in January, gained weight after shedding some pounds in 2016 with help from Blac



Proud of her progress: Blac Chyna, who'd delivered Rob's daughter Dream in November, uploaded an Instagram photo showcasing her trimmed-down post-baby body on Wednesday




Meanwhile Blac, 28, who delivered Rob's daughter Dream in November, uploaded an Instagram picture showcasing her trimmed-down post-baby body the same day.In Chyna's photo, her hair was gathered into a massive bun, and she wore nothing but black panties and a black turtlenecked crop topAfter his Instagram update regarding his gym trip, Rob uploaded a trio of photos of his daughter, the first showing her in a pink baby dress.



'Dreeeeezy': After his Instagram update regarding his gym trip, Rob uploaded a trio of photos of his daughter, the first showing her in a pink baby dress







'Inspiration'/'Motivation': The next two photos showed the laughing three-month-old wearing a pink bib that read: 'PRINCESS HAPPY' over an embroidered image of an owl'Dreeeeezy,' he captioned, following up the text with an emoji of a smiling face that'd got a halo encircling it about its forehead.The next two photos showed the laughing three-month-old wearing a pink bib that read: 'PRINCESS HAPPY' over an embroidered image of an owl.'This is my inspiration,' her father captioned the first photo, and the follow-up came with a similar message: 'This is my motivation.' 



A place in the sun: Monday saw an Instagram photo of a gorgeous landscape view, taken during what Rob referred to in his caption as 'hike time'There are contradicting reports this week about whether Rob and exotic-dancer-turned-reality-star Chyna, who'd got engaged last April, are still together.The Rob & Chyna co-stars briefly and dramatically split in December, with Rob uploading a Snapchat video in which he bewailed the breakup in their vacant house. Though the duo rejoined shortly thereafter, People was claiming by last month that the E! reality stars had broken their engagement.However, E! News quoted a source Wednesday who said they've been 'working on staying together and focusing on Dream.'Apparently, 'The main reason why the Kardashian family is so involved with Dream is Kris, who has worked hard to focus Rob on being present for his daughter.'Said the source: 'Kris has been super focused on being the rock, and she's building a bridge between Chyna and the rest of family.'



On or off?: There have been rumors recently about whether Rob and exotic-dancer-turned-reality-star Chyna, who'd got engaged last April, are still togetherRob & Chyna, which concluded its first season last October and has been picked up for a second, remains in production as well, despite trouble between the couple.An E! spokesperson said: 'We are continuing to shoot with all the family members, and are covering Rob and his relationship with Chyna.'Us Weekly however had a more pessimistic outlook on the situation with sources claiming filming on Rob & Chyna has stalled.Per one source: 'It was hard for them to film season one, and season two is not happening. They can’t even get through a day together - logistically they can’t do it.'That source went on to dish that 'They coparent Dream, but they don’t spend time together with Dream,' and another source said: 'They are definitely not living together.' 



The stories: Though E! News quoted a source Wednesday saying they've been 'working on staying together,' Us Weekly cited a source the same day said that 'They coparent Dream, but they don't spend time together with Dream'

title: 'I am strong, I am invincible, I am woman': Kerry Washington, Adele, and Emma Watson lead a host of A-listers proudly posting on social media in support of International Women's Day
content:
Hollywood is coming out in full force to support today's dual holiday, International Women's Day and A Day Without a Woman.Male and female stars alike have been taking to social media all day to post inspirational words and images of themselves wearing red in honor of today's protest.Ronda Rousey, Kerry Washington, Adele, and Reese Witherspoon have all chimed in to celebrate the women in their lives and those who have paved the way for them.Scroll down for video 



You go girls! Stars including Kerry Washington showed their support for International Women's Day on social media on Wednesday



Cute: Amy Schumer posted this photos said her three-year-old niece said she wants to be a woman when she grows up



Fab fashion: Nashville star Connie Britton sported a 'Phenomenal Woman' tee



How sweet: Supermodel Karlie Kloss paid tribute to her mother







Connie directed fans to buy a similar tee, while Karlie honored women who have inspired her



Tennis star Serena Williams held up a sign reading '#StrengthHasNoGender'Tributes have been popping up all day on Instagram, Twitter, and Snapchat from actors, singers, models, and other famous personalities. Scandal star Kerry Washington turned up on set in a shirt reading 'A Day Without a Woman' and shared several images of herself in it.'At work to support my bad*ss boss lady [Shonda Rhimes[ and all the women in our work world but I'm wearing red in solidarity with my sisters!' she wrote.Nashville star Connie Britton wore a  'Phenomenal Woman' shirt and wrote: 'Happy International Women's Day! I've already been having a full day celebrating PHENOMENAL WOMEN around the world. And I've got my red shoes on too! Hope y'all are celebrating the women in your life today too.'Amy Schumer, whose newest comedy special was just released on Netflix, uploaded a snapshot of herself with her young niece.

Feminism rules! Emma Watson wore red and showed off some reading material



Boys cam be feminists, too! Reese Witherspoon Snapchatted a picture of her youngest son








The next generation: Supermodel Lily Aldridge Instagrammed a mommy-and-me picture



Giving thanks: Ellen DeGeneres said she was thankful to the women who fought for her



Sharon Stone added a message about the women's strike held today



Caitlyn Jenner uploaded a video on Instagram for the occasion



She told followers to go to one.org to join the #GirlsCount campaign'When my 3 year old niece was asked what she wanted to be when she grew up she said without hesitation "a woman,"' she wrote. Amy's lookalike, UFC star Ronda Rousey, tweeted a photo of the Fearless Girl statue that popped up on Wall Street today with the hashtag #resist.Beauty and the Beast star Emma Watson, a vocal advocate for women's rights, posted a picture of herself in red holding a book by feminist icon Gloria Steinem and saying she is out to share a 'wise woman's words'.'I'm grateful to all the women who came before me and fought for me to be able to be where I am,' wrote Ellen DeGeneres.Caitlyn Jenner joined in, too, sharing a video asking people to join the #GirlsCount by One.Some women paid tribute to others with touching pictures — including Bindi Irwin, who shared a picture of her mother.



Actress Elizabeth Banks showed off her pro-women tee on Instagram



YouTuber Ingrid Nilsen wore red and shared a cute picture on Instagram



Ladies: Bindi Irwin tweeted a picture of her with her mother



Jaimie Alexander was one of many stars wearing red which represents 'revolutionary love and sacrifice'



Snark: J.K. Rowling had a ready retort for bitter people who whine about there not being an International Men's Day'To the strongest and most beautiful woman I have ever known - my gorgeous Mum. I love you forever,' she wrote. 'This #InternationalWomensDay I wanted to honor a few of the brave and brilliant women whose life stories and accomplishments have inspired me (and countless others) to reach higher, work harder, and dare to do the impossible,' wrote Karlie Kloss. 'Today we celebrate you, the icons, artists, nerds, explorers, activists.' Cher and Madonna both hoped for a better world, with the former wishing followers 'a day free of mansplaining, sexual harassment, & general misogyny' and the latter 'Dreaming of a World Where Women have Equal Rights [sic]'.'Women's day?! HELLS TO THE YEAH,' wrote Game of Thrones star Emilia Clarke, who also guest-edited Huffington post Women's Day edition. 



Mom love: Gigi Hadid said her mother Yolanda has inspired her



Katie Couris was joined by Leona Lewis, Kris Jenner, and Sabrina Carpenter



While Bella Thorne shared a picture, male celebs like David Beckham also offered support



Lindsay Lohan posted this image of herself with a quote by the Prophet Muhammad



'Women are not created weaker but more generous than men,' the quote readChicago PD star Sophia Bush shared a heartfelt message, writing: 'Solidarity. The Statue Of Liberty is dark today. #ADayWithoutWomen #InternationalWomensDay However you choose to express your solidarity — striking, wearing red, making phone calls to your reps, only spending money at women-owned businesses (one of or all of these things) — thank you.'Kim Kardashian thanked 'all of the strong women who fought & continue to fight for change', Lindsay Lohan quoted the Prophet Mohammed, and Ariel Winter saluted 'bold women across the world'.  'I am strong, I am invincible, I am woman,' wrote Katie Couris. 'Happy #InternationalWomensDay to all you female badasses!'Harry Potter author J.K. Rowling even offered up some snark, writing: 'Happy #InternationalWomensDay or, as it's often called on here, #WhyIsn'tThereAnInternationalMensDay (There is: November 19th).'Elizabeth Banks, YouTuber Ingrid Nilson, Alyssa Milano, Krysten Ritter, Adele, Vanessa Williams, Martha Stewart, Amber Tamblyn, Disney star Sabrina Carpenter, Serena Williams, Lily Aldridge, Leona Lewis, Kris Jenner, Bella Thorne, Jaimie Alexander, and Sharon Stone all chimed in as well, as did male allies David Beckham, Jussie Smollet, Justin Trudeau, Lin-Manuel Miranda, and Harry Connick, Jr.

title: 'Down to 148lbs!': Blac Chyna celebrates weight loss with sexy photo shoot after hitting 192lbs when pregnant
content:
Blac Chyna sure has no problem losing baby weight.The reality star took to Snapchat on Wednesday to reveal she is already down to 148lbs after welcoming her daughter Dream four months ago. The reality TV wonder also said she weighed 192lbs when pregnant.The beauty also shared footage from a photo shoot where she looked much more slender in a pink cat suit, beige heels and a blunt-cut blonde wig.  



Slim: Blac Chyna took to Snapchat on Wednesday to reveal she is already down to 148lbs after welcoming her daughter Dream four months agoThis posting comes after TMZ reported Chyna has allowed beau Rob Kardashian back into her Calabasas mansion after a split in February.The site then shared an update that they were not back on, but rather he was just visiting Dream.It was added he was trying to be a good father and take care of his health.Later E! News stated that the two are getting closer and are 'working on their relationship.'












Not more donuts: Blac also shared footage from a photo shoot where she looked much more slender in a pink cat suit, beige heels and a blunt-cut blonde wig



'Working on something for my Chyna Dolls': The star's face also looked more slimmer as she wore light pink lipstickAlso on Wednesday, Chyna was seen with a male friend in LA.She wore a black hat that said Empire and also had on a black top and capri leggings with slides. In a Snapchat image, Chyna showed her bare feet - which had several tattoos on them - as she stood on a scale.The scale read 148.8lbs to be exact. She wrote, 'From 192 to 148.8.'








Weee! Perhaps Chyna - joined by two gal pals - was filming the second season of her E! spin-off as the roller rink was closed to the public on Monday and Tuesday







Skating: The Lashed salon owner looked a bit unsteady on the rink while wearing black leggings with a baggy T-shirt featuring a corseted back



Cardio session: On Wednesday night, the 28-year-old (born Angela White) Snapchatted her adventures at the Moonlight Rollerway in Glendale



Lean on me: Also on Wednesday, Chyna was seen with a male friend at Independence Studio in LA







Not a boyfriend: The mystery man was most likely Kellon Deryck, Blac's hairdresser/wig stylist as seen on the set in the same black outfit



Ready for her close-up: The heavily-tattooed pin-up has something in the worksThe former best friend of Kim Kardashian has been showing off her figure on Instagram since December.In TMZ's Wednesday report, they added that Chyna's neighbors are annoyed. According to the site, some of the people who live around her have complained that her 'thug friends' climb over the security walls to hang out at the posh home where they make noise at all hours of the night.Residents are required to drive through the main gate where there is a guard shack. 



With child: The reality TV wonder also said she weighed 192lbs when pregnant; here she is seen with Rob Kardashian

Pictured MayThe locals think it is a 'dangerous situation.' When police were in the community on Tuesday for 'an unrelated matter' several neighbors 'flagged them down and ticked off a laundry list of complaints against Rob and Chyna,' the site claimed. The worst was the 'thugs' visiting her home, according to the source.It was alleged the men did not go through the front gate but rather 'jumped the wall, avoiding security.'








He's home! The curvy model's Los Angeles mansion that is located in an exclusive, gated community



Posh life: Her 'thug friends' climb over the security walls. title: 'She is NOT a good example of feminism': Piers Morgan and Annie Lennox slam Kim Kardashian for her topless selfies during interview with Helen Pankhurst
content:
He slammed Kim Kardashian last May after she defended her right to post naked selfies and Piers Morgan laid into the reality star once again on Wednesday morning. Appearing on Good Morning Britain, the 51-year-old was joined by singer Annie Lennox and Helen Pankhurst, granddaughter of Emmeline, where the subject of Kim came up. Piers said: 'I saw Kim Kardashian flipping the bird doing a topless selfie to her millions of followers, many of whom are impressionable young girls –that can’t be a good example of feminism.'  








'She is NOT a good example of feminism': Piers Morgan and Annie Lennox slammed Kim Kardashian for her topless selfies as they joined Helen Pankhurst on GMB on Wednesday



Piers Morgan told Annie Lennox (second from left) and Helen Pankhurst (left) : 'I saw Kim Kardashian flipping the bird doing a topless selfie to her millions of followers, many of whom are impressionable young girls –that can’t be a good example of feminism''She does it in the name of liberating and empowering women and feminism, to me that can’t be and shouldn’t be what feminism is.’Annie concurred: 'That’s her version of feminism, it’s not mine and it’s not Helen's'.

She continued: 'For me, because of my absolute commitment to that issue, I’ve been to Ethopia and done things courtesy of Comic Relief.'I'm deeply involved in the basic things like trying to get women access to education, let alone basic pay. The western world is in a bubble.' 



He's not a fan: Kim's famous flipping the bird selfie posted with Emily Ratajkowski was brought up by Piers as a bad example of feminism







Hitting out: Eurythmics star Annie was not impressed with Kim's interpretation of feminism  



Heated: Kim was the source of much debate during Wednesday morning's edition of Good Morning Britain Piers also talked about his issue with Madonna's presence at the Women's March in Washington in January. He said: 'My issue was not people marching for women’s rights bit when I see Madonna standing on a stage saying I dream of blowing up a White House.'Helen said: 'That idea of well-behaved women saying we’ll quietly change things doesn’t wash.



Annie concurred: 'That’s her version of feminism, it’s not mine and it’s not Helen's''Now and again we have to use forceful arguments, by just packing on the extremes and saying that’s no good, its not going to work. The world is still unequal.' Annie said: 'Everyone’s asking me about Donald Trump and one of our challenges as feminism is to have a platform. 'A few years ago it was really hard to just use the word. Now you see the word because it seems to have died.'  



Not impressed: Piers also talked about his issue with Madonna's presence at the Women's March in Washington in January



He said: 'My issue was not people marching for women’s rights bit when I see Madonna standing on a stage saying I dream of blowing up a White House'Meanwhile, Kim defended her right to post naked selfies while on the red carpet at the Vogue 100 gala dinner in London last May.She said at the time: 'For me, it wasn't even about flaunting it. I felt good about myself so let ME do what I feel comfortable with. If you are conservative and if you're not comfortable with that, that's amazing, too.'But Piers said: 'She's wrong about the naked selfies. Do that to Kanye. I've got no problem with what she does in her own life. 



Empowering: 'I'm deeply involved in the basic things like trying to get women access to education, let alone basic pay. The western world is in a bubble,' Annie added



Moving on: 'Everyone’s asking me about Donald Trump and one of our challenges as feminism is to have a platform. 'A few years ago it was really hard to just use the word. Now you see the word because it seems to have died,' she said




Adding: 'Doing it to a bunch of millions of young girls... is that really the arbiter of success for women in the world now? No, it's not... Be stylish. Be cool, be sexy, be genuinely empowering.'He also criticised Harriet Harman for standing up for Kim and her topless snaps.He said: 'Now she wholeheartedly supports her topless selfies, saying they're empowering women and it's all about gender equality.'Harriet's digging herself in a little hole here,' he said. 'She needs to work out whether it is or isn't offensive.'



Iconic: Helen Pankhurst is the granddaughter of suffragette Emmeline who helped women win the right to vote

title: Woman, 20, who started wearing corsets at 13 to fix a curve in her spine has sculpted a tiny 18 INCH waist (after splashing out $1,400 on underwear)
content:
A woman who started wearing corsets under her school uniform as a teenager giving her a miniscule 18-inch waist – half the size of the US average 37.5 inches. Raquel Skellington, 20, from New York laced up her first corset at just 13 years old in order to fix a curve in her spine, which was causing her bottom to stick out, prompting classmates to cruelly dub her 'duck butt'.Now, almost eight years on, Rachel – who has splashed out $1,460 (£1,200) on her corsets – models the racy underwear and practices tight-lacing, which has seen her be able to reduce her waist by five inches.



Raquel Skellington, 20, from New York at her first photo shoot, aged 18, modelling the corset she wears to give herself a tiny 18 inch waist 



At 18 inches, Raquel's waist is half the size of the average US woman's 



Raquel's natural waist is 23 inches, but she can get it down to 18 with a tightly laced corset The 20-year-old said: 'I started wearing corsets when I was quite young as my spine was like a 'J', not an 'I', so my butt stuck out and people made fun of me.'I did my research and talked to my mum, Lynnette, 53, who works as a nurse, and she gave me her blessing.

'I began wearing a corset under my school uniform. It helped to give me support, forced me to stand up straight and brought my bum in.'It didn't hurt and my friends would say I was wearing my armour.'



Raquel, wearing an 18 inch corset closed, in late 2016. She started wearing the garments when she was 13 to help with back problems 



Raquel, in a 20 inch corset laced up, aged 18. She can now get into a corset two inches smaller thanks to tight lacing 



The 20-year-old had back problems as a teenager and then wore corsets again to help her heal after fracturing her spine But, just two years later, Raquel came off her bike whilst on a camping trip, fracturing her lower spine, dislocating her left shoulder, knee and hip and suffering cuts.She added: 'Doctors said I might not be able to walk properly once I healed, and would probably have a limp.'Following the accident, a heavily sedated Raquel remained in hospital for 36 hours, before returning to camp, where she spent a further ten days recovering.



Raquel has spent more than $1,400 on her corsets with her most expensive one costing $280Raquel did not go home due to the distance away, and found that staying at camp meant she could be a little active, which helped her heal.A camp leader helped her out of bed each morning.Once back home, she decided to put her corset back on, hoping it would realign everything and give her extra support, helping her heal.'I did this without anyone recommending it, but I knew it had helped my back before,' she explained.



Raquel, as a teenager and dressed for her high school prom, with her mum Lynnette and dad Derrick



Raquel, in a 23 inch corset not laced up, aged 16 or 17. A year or so before she wore a corset after coming off her bike and injuring her back



Raquel, aged 17, dressed up for a sci-fi, fantasy and gaming convention, in 2015'About six months later my doctor said if I hadn't been wearing it, then I might not have healed and would have had a limp.'Although she started wearing a corset for medical reasons, she soon got into modelling them for fun and built up a collection.Now, she has a collection of 12. Her most expensive cost around $280 (£228), but she usually splurges around $160 (£130) a piece.She's been getting in to the practice of tight lacing – wearing a tightly laced corset to reduce the waist circumference.



Raquel, 20, in February 2017. She insists that her corsets don't hurt and that they shouldn't be restrictive or uncomfortable to wear But at 16 she began with waist training, which Kim Kardashian has posted about online, and sees the wearer slip in to increasingly smaller sized corsets overtime, in order to be left with a reduced waistline.From there she moved on to tight lacing, which brings the waist in by several inches in one go, but the wearer only endures this for a short length of time.Raquel said: 'My natural waist is 23 inches, and my first tight-lace corset was 20. I can go to 18 now. My body is used to that reduction after 18 months of tight lacing.







Raquel, in a 23 inch corset not laced up, aged 16 or 17. A year or so before she wore a corset after coming off her bike and injuring her back (left) and in a 20 inch waist, aged 18 (right)'But 18 inches is the most I'll go. It gets to a point where I can't lace any further.'This looks aesthetically pleasing and it's not extreme.'Raquel added that boyfriend, Will Stephenson, also 20, who is studying robotic engineering in Manchester, thinks her corsetry is cool and attractive.She also insists that it has never hurt as she has grown used to it over time.



The corsetry fan insists she's able to comfortably able to run around in the tightly laced garment 



Raquel in London with her boyfriend Will, who is studying robotic engineering in Manchester, in January 2017



Raquel, wearing a corset not laced up, in 2015. She's since shaved extra inches off her waist through lacing 'It's like wearing new hiking boots – you need to break a corset in like boots,' she said.'Some girls say they hurt and people ask how can you breathe, but if you get a made to measure corset it fits right and you don't feel it.'I want to stress that it shouldn't hurt at all, if you wear the proper size and go slowly, moving to smaller sizes, and are aware of your body and what it can take.'Although there are myths around corsets, like that they break ribs, for Raquel, there haven't been any negative effects.




She continued: 'My organs are intact, I'm not shifting anything around, I have no shortness of breath.'I can exercise. I'm into LARPing – fantasy live action role-play – and wear one when I play a healer and run around in it then.'There is such a thing as too small. You need to balance your top and bottom.'I'm very small, short, thin, I'm blessed with a top and hips so I can go to extremes without looking freakish but people are like, "you look great".'

On call! title: Man, 74, is arrested for destroying six Kim Kardashian selfie books at Barnes & Noble because he 'disliked the celebrity and people like her'
content:
An elderly man was arrested for destroying six of Kim Kardashian's selfie books at a Barnes & Noble by pouring red liquid on them because he disliked the celebrity and people like her. Carl Puia, 74, had walked into a Barnes & Noble bookstore, pulled out a red liquid and proceeded to dump the mess onto several copies of Kim Kardashian's Selfish books, back in October of 2016.Surveillance video captured the hoodlum from Glastonbury, Connecticut, and he turned himself in on Monday and was charged with third-degree criminal mischief.







Carl Puia, 74, (left) destroyed six Kim Kardashian selfie books (right) at a Glastonbury, Connecticut, Barnes & Noble by pouring red liquid on them back in October of 2016



Puia left a lengthy note for the store's employees, explaining that he didn't like Kardashian (pictured with husband Kanye West) or people like her. He was arrested on MondayPuia had left a lengthy note for staff explaining why he thought the store shouldn't be stocking the books, mentioning his distaste for the celebrity and people like her, according to the police report. His objection to the social media vixen was taken out on her book of selfies, and they were 'destroyed in the massacre and could not be revived,' police told NBC Chicago.

title: From 'INSECTILE' smoky-eye make-up to CHAIN-embellished manicures: See the most outrageous Fashion Week beauty looks from New York to Paris
content:
Every season there are certain shows at Fashion Week that you just know will bring out the crazy, wacky and, yes, sometimes even ugly hair, make-up and nail looks.Whether the designer is going for shock value, unparalleled originality, or ground-breaking innovation, these bold statements serve to remind us that fashion shows are, above all, a true art form.The fall 2017 season in New York City, London, Milan and Paris has officially come to a close, and, as far as balls-to-the-wall beauty goes, this has been one for the books.Below, we round up the biggest eyebrow-raising trends spotted on the runways.FACE EMBELLISHMENTS'It's all about creating a new texture and evolution of make-up as texture,' said Aaron De Mey of the herringbone fabric appliques he used in place of lipstick and eyebrow pencil backstage at Thom Browne's fall show. Pat McGrath was on the same page at Gucci, where she adorned models' cheeks, lips and eyes with materials like crystals and black feathers. Thick gold rings were placed over bare lips at Balmain, and pearls applied with Duo adhesive dotted faces at Manish Arora.The award for Most Otherworldly Look, however, goes to Val Garland, who led the make-up team backstage at Gareth Pugh. Customized three-dimensional 'bug eyes' were adhered over eyes on top of layers of black and deep teal pigment to create an 'insectile effect'.



Fly girl: A model at Gucci wore a feathered wig and feathers around her eyes







Bedazzled beauty: Metal and pearls were used as forms of make-up at Balmain (left) and Manish Arora (right)







Top it off: Materials like fabric and plastic added three-dimensional elements to the beauty looks at Thom browne (left) and Gareth Pugh (right)NAIL ACCESSORIES 'A flamboyant Romanian gypsy' inspired the bright and textured nail looks that took artists at CND 400 hours to produce ahead of Libertine's show during New York Fashion Week. Painted roses in a variety of hues anchored each design and were then embellished further with thread, gems, feathers and chains. Across town on the same day, nail artist Mei Kawajiri was busy taking the pierced nail trend (seen recently on the likes of Kim Kardashian) to the next level for Philipp Plein's show by hanging chains, hoops and safety pins from black acrylic manicures.

title: 'I felt inadequate because I was not a size 0': Former Bravo reality star who felt constant pressure to lose weight bravely poses in her underwear as she learns to embrace her size 12 figure
content:
A former Princesses of Long Island star who has been cruelly ridiculed for her appearance has shared candid photos of herself in only a bra and underwear as an exercise in learning to love herself.After years of struggling with her weight and realizing that even at her thinnest, she wasn't happy, television personality and radio host Chanel Omari, 32, is on a mission to get healthy by eating right, working out, and learning to 'feel sexy no matter what'.'I want to take you on my journey of acceptance starting today by baring my heart, soul and well yes ... my true body,' she explained while sharing three side-by-side photos of herself in her underwear on Instagram. Scroll down for video  



Learning self-love: Chanel Omari shared three photos of herself in her bra and underwear on her Instagram page last week 



Going public: The 32-year-old former Princesses of Long Island star is on a mission to learn to love her body and be as healthy as possible Chanel, who now works for the Long Island radio station 106.1 BLI, told Daily Mail Online that posting that photo on Instagram for everyone to see was the first step in learning how to love her body.'Social media, nowadays, is all we look at for validation and it sets us up for an extraordinary amount of pressure,' she said. 'I was tired of caving into these pressures; I was tired of the smoke and mirrors, and I was tired of this fake world.'The television personality used to strive to be a size 2-4, but even when she achieved her goal weight in her early 20s, she noted that she was 'probably the most miserable person would ever meet'.The weight loss made her feel even more insecure and paranoid about what others thought about her, and she now feels happier at a size 12 and weighing 149lbs because she is finally embracing who she is. Chanel was inspired to make a change in her life when she saw the documentary Embrace, which follows Taryn Brumfitt as she explores the global issue of body loathing.

Healthy habit: Chanel recently shared a video of herself taking a Tracy Anderson workout class



Strike a pose: The television personality and radio host said she would be lying if she said she wasn't affected by constantly being surrounded by thin celebrities After evaluating her relationship with her own body, Chanel realized that the shame she felt about her weight was thrust upon her by other people. 'All they cared about if I was going to look skinny for that interview or red carpet event or audition,' she said. 'I got sick of it and said to myself, "Everyone else is unhappy with my body weight but me. I am good with it. I love every curve and every fat on my body because it's mine."' All they cared about if I was going to look skinny for that interview or red carpet Chanel had struggled her weight her entire life, and when she was in high school she said no guy would look at her as anything more than a friend because she was heavier than the rest of her female peers.By the time she was a sophomore in college, Chanel shed 30lbs because she thought putting and to her weight fluctuations would make her happy.  'I never felt so beautiful and ugly at the same time in my life,' she explained. 'I felt thin but it still wasn't enough. I was always trying to be fit or lose more weight. I wasn't myself and I wasn't happy, just because I was thinner.' 



Harsh words: When she was on the Bravo reality show Princesses of Long Island in 2013, she said online bullies would tell her she was a 'fat slob' and 'had to get a nose job'







Not enough: Chanel, who is now a size 12, said she is happier now than when she reached her goal of being a size 2-4. She is pictured in 2013 (left) and in January 2017 (right)The entertainment journalist has interviewed numerous celebrities and fashion designers throughout her career, and she admitted she would be lying if she said working in an appearance-driven industry has never affected her. 'There have been times I felt inadequate because I was overweight or not a size 0 and even felt discriminated against or treated unfairly because of it,' she said.Chanel recalled working on a photo shoot for a well-known designer when she was cruelly criticized for her weight.'I was about 130 pounds at the time, very curvy, a little overweight, not in shape and she came up to me in front of everyone, body shamed me and told me if I wanted to work for the company I needed to be a size 0-2,' she said. 'I never felt so depleted and helpless. I thought to myself, "How can I be judged for my weight and not my soul or characteristics?"' 



Struggle: Chanel said she had trouble finding clothes for New York Fashion Week, but she ended up wearing a 'Kim Kardashian-style' sweatshirt that made her feel sexy 



Old friends: Chanel, who is pictured with Lindsay Lohan's mother Dina, said she once worked with a designer who told her she needed to be a size 0-2 to work for the label



Heartbreak: Chanel said she even felt pressure to lose weight from her now ex-boyfriend, who has a history of dating models In 2013, Chanel was in her late 20s when she starred in the first and only season of the Bravo reality series Princesses of Long Island, and she can still recall being shamed on social media because of her size.'I was probably the one out of the entire cast that was scrutinized and ridiculed the most for my physical appearance and my body weight,' she said, explaining that would tweet that she was a 'fat slob' and 'had to get a nose job'.   I hope to find my true happiness and love every inch of my body Even her now ex-boyfriend made her feel insecure about her weight by watching everything she ate and criticizing her. 'There were times he even made me feel ugly, fat, and sloppy, and that's why he couldn't be with me,' she said. 'He ended up dating models after me, which obviously didn't make me feel good about myself. 'Of course, I felt if I just lost that weight or was in better shape maybe he would still be with me today. Maybe he would still love me? Maybe I would finally be good enough for him, but then I realized it was never about him.



Lesson learned: 'I had to love myself first before anyone else could love me,' she explained. Chanel shared this throwback photo of herself on Instagram last August 



Living her life: Chanel, who is pictured eating with Jonathan Cheban, said the goal is to be 'happy, healthy and not deprive myself'



End game: The television personalty said she ultimately hopes to find true happiness. Chanel is pictured with singer Pia Toscano last May 'It was about me accepting myself for me. It was about me loving every part of me and being OK with who I was no matter what I looked like — even though the guy I loved and wanted to marry didn't see me in that way.'However, Chanel admitted that after they broke up, she gained weight because she started eating her feelings, and she ultimately felt even worse. 'I had to love myself first before anyone else could love me,' she explained.Over the past few days, Chanel has continued her project by sharing videos of herself thanking her supporters, and most recently, a clip of her taking one of Tracy Anderson's fitness classes.  As part of her journey, she is working out and focusing on eating healthy nutritious meals and snacks. But she doesn't have a certain weight loss goal in mind; she just wants to live her best life.  'My goal by the end of this project is to be fit and get myself back in to shape so I can be healthier than ever — mind, body, and soul,' she explained. 'I hope to find my true happiness and love every inch of my body.'

title: Kendall Jenner flaunts her tiny waist in a cropped fur jacket as she joins supermodel sisters Bella and Gigi Hadid after the Chanel show at Paris Fashion Week

Model moment: Kendall Jenner, and Bella and Gigi Hadid proved that they can turn just as many heads off the runway as they dazzled whilst leaving the Grand Palais after storming the catwalk at the Chanel Paris Fashion Week show on Tuesday

Sweeping her raven coloured locks into a ponytail, the model opted for a neutral make-up palette that allowed her natural beauty to shine through, whilst she accessorised with circular shades from Oliver Peoples.Looking equally as chic was Bella Hadid, 20, who dazzled in a grey pinstripe midi dress with a thigh high split that offered a look at her tanned and toned pins. 







Furry nice! Leading the way, Kendall, 21, showed off her style prowess in a cropped fur jacket that sheathed her lithe frame and ensured all eyes would be firmly on her as she sashayed out of the building



Leggy lady! The Keeping Up With The Kardashians star teamed the garment with high-waisted stone coloured trousers which cinched in at her slender waist before billowing out and grazing her ankles to reveal a pair of nude heels with black tipsLayering up, the brunette beauty donned a long grey duster coat, whilst she added some extra height to her frame in a pair of taupe knee high heeled boots.Keeping her accessories simple, the starlet donned a cerulean shoulder bag, and injected another splash of colour with a pair of yellow sunglasses. Her impeccable sense of style was rivalled only by elder sister Gigi, who oozed glamour in a pair of leather leggings that she teamed with stylish black biker boots. 











Flaunt it! Bella - the youngest daughter of Yolanda Foster - also looked incredible as she went nineties chic in a plunging grey pinstriped midi dress that flashed her honed legs with a daring thigh-high slit







Denim days: Gigi paid tribute to Chanel designer Karl Lagerfeld following the show as she donned a picture emblazoned tee of the creative while draping an oversized denim jacket around herPaying homage to Chanel's creative director, she slipped into a black Karl Lagerfeld T-shirt, whilst she layered up in an oversized denim jacket that she wore off the shoulder. Cinching in at her slender waist, the Vogue covergirl donned a thick zebra print belt, whilst a pair of cat eye sunglasses finished off the stylish look. The outing came after the trio hit the catwalk at the hotly-anticipated show. Bella lead the way as she slipped into a figure-flaunting mini-dress that exhibited her leafy frame with crystal shoulder embellishment as she pounded the catwalk. 











Ruling the runway: Bella Hadid showcased why she is the model of the moment as she displayed her signature strut down the futuristic themed runway for Chanel's AW17 show during Paris Fashion Week alongside her sister Gigi (centre) and pal Kendall Jenner (R) on TuesdayWalking in the acclaimed presentation, her crystal encrusted hem accentuated the space-themed event as she boasted a pair of cycling inspired shorts under the mini dress with aplomb.Teaming the look with a pair of head-turning silver sequin tights, the fashion darling slipped on a pair of glitter clad knee-high boots with patent leather toe. The style maven worked her trademark raven-locks into a voluminous coif held off her face with a complementing bead and crystal encrusted headband that was sure to become a statement piece of the decadent collection. The Californian beauty's sparkle speckled garment was exquisite with it's many intricate crystal embellishment. 







Style star: The 20-year-old beauty slipped into a figure-flaunting mini-dress that exhibited her leafy frame with crystal shoulder embellishment as she pounded the catwalk











Glitter gal: Teaming the look with a pair of head-turning silver sequin tights, the fashion darling slipped on a pair of glitter clad knee-high boots with patent leather toe



Leading the charge: Bella led the charge at the space-themed runway show in her eclectic look



Metallic mademoiselle! The style star worked a number of metallic pieces into her look, much like her fellow modelsKarl Largerfeld's creation kept to his demure standards as is featured incredible shoulder pad detail that accentuated Bella's towering frame down the runway. Bella's beauty look for the highly-awaited presentation was reminiscent of the make-up from Black Swan with the exaggerated black shadow creased eye and winged liner. Taking on the runway alongside her younger sister once again, Gigi, 21, looked sensational in her houndstooth wool jumpsuit that highlighted her statuesque beauty.Her eye-catching flared piece displayed her slender frame as she sashayed down the runway with signature Lagerfield metallic finger-less gloves and quilted cross body bag with black and gold accents. 







Runway ready: Taking on the runway alongside her younger sister once again, Gigi, 21, looked sensational in her houndstooth wool jumpsuit that highlighted her statuesque beauty











Chanel-ational: Her eye-catching flared piece displayed her slender frame as she sashayed down the runway with signature Lagerfield metallic finger-less gloves and quilted cross body bag with black and gold accents







Own it! Gigi was focused when she took to the space themed runway with neutral facial expression



Rocket women: A space rocket remained centre of the presentation as models lined the runwayClad in the same eye-popping boots, she wowed the style brigade in her three-quarter length number that oozed vintage vibes. Monochrome appeared to be the tone of the show as Kendall Jenner, 21, took to the runway clad in a show-stopping mixed tweed coat that boasted shaggy black cuffs and collar.Channeling the swinging sixties, the warmth-inducing number draped over the reality star's lean figure as she took to the white catwalk with confidence.Kendall - who recently filmed a cameo alongside sister Kim Kardashian for Ocean's 8 - donned a pair of matching knee-length shorts over her tight-clad pins. Equipped with a bouffant hairstyle, the E! star wrapped a glitter filled wool hairband around her mane that featured beaded detail. 











Monochrome muse: Monochrome appeared to be the tone of the show as Kendall Jenner, 21, took to the runway clad in a show-stopping mixed tweed coat that boasted shaggy black cuffs and collar







Chanel-ing: Channeling the swinging sixties, the warmth-inducing number draped over the reality star's lean figure as she took to the white catwalk with confidence











Hair-raisingly good: The trio each sported some type of textured hairband to maintain their tresses for the occasion







Style stars: Male model Lucky Blue Smith walked the runway in all white alongside show star Bella



He's arrived: Head Designer and Creative Director walked onto the catwalk show in his signature black suit in front of a number of white clad models



Designer duo: The acclaimed designer walked on the catwalk with his son Hudson - who was clad in ethereal all whiteMeanwhile, the Chanel show attracted the biggest names in fashion, film and music.While washboard abs seemed to be the key feature of the day, blonde hair also took over the FROW at the space-themed show as the guestlist features lots of celebrities with recently lightened locks. Supermodel Cara Delevingne, 24, looked incredibly glamorous showing off her recently shorten platinum tresses as she arrived at the venue to see Chanel's Fall-Winter 2017/2018 ready-to-wear fashion collection.











Karl's girls lighten up! Platinum babe Cara Delevingne (left) flashes her washboard abs in a cropped cardigan as fellow blonde Brits Rita Ora (centre) and Lily Allen (right) joined her at star-studded Chanel PFW show at the Grand Palais on Tuesday



Beam me up: No expense has been spared on the show which features a giant spaceship inside the venueLagerfeld's long-time muse flashed her tummy wearing a navy and gold cropped cardigan which was a modern take on a Chanel classic. She flashed the waistband of her Supreme boxers, also showing her support to the latest Louis Vuitton collaboration, whose show will feature later on in the day. Modelling sport luxe, she wore a pair of white tracksuit pants, lengthening her legs with a pair of heels. 







Lagerfeld's long-time muse: Cara (left) flashed her tummy wearing a navy and gold cropped cardigan which was a modern take on a Chanel classic, while Rita dazzled in her number (right) 











Glittering: Rita flashed a hint of skin in a plunging metallic top which had a velvet embellished panel at the front and completed her look with a pair of black trousers which had leather sections going down the front







All the little things: Rita even wore a pair of mini CC earrings as she showed her support for the high-end fashion houseHer eyes were hidden behind a pair of Chanel frames and she wore a smattering of necklaces for added glamour. Likewise, singer Rita Ora, 26, let her hair do the talking, flaunting her mane which was blow-dried to perfection. She flashed a hint of skin in a plunging metallic top  which had a velvet embellished panel at the front and completed her look with a pair of black trousers which had leather sections going down the front. Carrying a mini green Chanel bag on her shoulder, the pop of colour drew in the eye and she wore a pair of strappy heels which were decorated in Chanel's signature chainlink. 







Out of this world: Models sported clean lines and monochrome colours with silver glittered boots











Metallic moment: A number of model sported astronaut printed dresses, silver accessorises and trademark Chanel beading







Mixing it up: A model sports a boucle colourful tweed suit down the catwalk while another stuns in all white



We have lift-off: Spectators saw the branded rocket take off as models paraded the latest collection at the showLily Allen, 31, pulled off a rather regal look wearing an all-black ensemble which contrasted heavily with her platinum blonde locks. Her jacket held a very theatrical shape with puff-sleeves which she teamed with velvet wide-legged trousers and T-bar heels. She proudly clutched her quilted handbag in front of her body as she posed for a series of snaps. 



Mother and daughter: They were in good company on the day as Chanel model and actress Vanessa Paradis (left) was joined by her child with Johnny Depp, Lily-Rose (right)











Showing off her sporty side: Lily wore striped tracksuit bottoms with strappy sandals as she flashed her washboard stomach with a zipped cardigan (left and right) as her mother kept it low-key in jeans (centre) 



Close: The similarity between the two stunning ladies was striking as they posed for pictures together They were in good company on the day as Chanel model and actress Vanessa Paradis was joined by her daughter with Johnny Depp,  Lily-Rose. Lily wore striped tracksuit bottoms with strappy sandals as she flashed her washboard stomach with a zipped cardigan. Her mother kept it casual in grey jeans as they posed for pictures together.Lottie Moss wore a pink lingerie inspired dress with black suede ankle booties.Model Alice Dellal wore head-to-toe leather, while US Editor-in-Chief Anna Wintour nailed the monochrome theme, as musician Pharrell Williams continued with the sports luxe theme. 



Ready for bed: Lottie Moss wore a pink lingerie inspired dress with black suede ankle booties 











All stars: (L-R) Model Alice Dellal wore head-to-toe leather, while US Editor-in-Chief Anna Wintour nailed the monochrome theme, as musician Pharrell Williams continued with the sports luxe theme

title: Très Bell-a! Hadid dazzles in futuristic black mini dress as she rules the runway alongside sister Gigi and pal Kendall Jenner in space-themed Chanel runway show at Paris Fashion Week
content:
She has become one of the go-to models in fashion when it comes to fashion weeks around the globe.And Bella Hadid showcased why she is the model of the moment as she displayed her signature strut down the futuristic themed runway for Chanel's AW17 show during Paris Fashion Week alongside her sister Gigi and pal Kendall Jenner on Tuesday. The 20-year-old beauty slipped into a figure-flaunting mini-dress that exhibited her leafy frame with crystal shoulder embellishment as she pounded the catwalk. Scroll down for video  











Ruling the runway: Bella Hadid showcased why she is the model of the moment as she displayed her signature strut down the futuristic themed runway for Chanel's AW17 show during Paris Fashion Week alongside her sister Gigi (centre) and pal Kendall Jenner (R) on TuesdayWalking in the acclaimed presentation, her crystal encrusted hem accentuated the space-themed event as she boasted a pair of cycling inspired shorts under the mini dress with aplomb.Teaming the look with a pair of head-turning silver sequin tights, the fashion darling slipped on a pair of glitter clad knee-high boots with patent leather toe.

Equipped with a bouffant hairstyle, the E! star wrapped a glitter filled wool hairband around her mane that featured beaded detail. Following the show, sisters Bella and Gigi showcased their post-presentation style with the fashionistas both flaunting their legs.The youngest daughter of Yolanda Foster went nineties chic in a plunging grey pinstriped midi dress that flashed her honed legs with a daring thigh-high slit.Baring a frayed hem, Bella teamed her waist-cinching number with a matching blazer under her wool duster coat in the fashion capital.  Keeping to an all grey theme, she adorned her feet in a pair of over-the-knee suede boots while accessorising her retro look with a number of silver necklaces and yellow lens aviators. 







Pin-credible: Following the show, sisters Bella and Gigi showcased their post-presentation style with the fashionistas both flaunting their legs











Flaunt it! The youngest daughter of Yolanda Foster went nineties chic in a plunging grey pinstriped midi dress that flashed her honed legs with a daring thigh-high slit







Denim days: The US stunner paid tribute to Chanel designer Karl Lagerfeld following the show as she donned a picture emblazoned tee of the creative while draping an oversized denim jacket around herGoing for an edgy look, older sibling Gigi slipped on a pair of leather trousers that accentuated her lithe limbs.The US stunner paid tribute to Chanel designer Karl Lagerfeld following the show as she donned a picture emblazoned tee of the creative while draping an oversized denim jacket around her.Working her tresses into a slicked back chignon, she upped the style stakes with her cat-eye shades while her waist was framed with a monochrome belt around her. Meanwhile, the Chanel show attracted the biggest names in fashion, film and music.While washboard abs seemed to be the key feature of the day, blonde hair also took over the FROW at the space-themed show as the guestlist features lots of celebrities with recently lightened locks. Supermodel Cara Delevingne, 24, looked incredibly glamorous showing off her recently shorten platinum tresses as she arrived at the venue to see Chanel's Fall-Winter 2017/2018 ready-to-wear fashion collection.











Karl's girls lighten up! Platinum babe Cara Delevingne (left) flashes her washboard abs in a cropped cardigan as fellow blonde Brits Rita Ora (centre) and Lily Allen (right) joined her at star-studded Chanel PFW show at the Grand Palais on Tuesday



Beam me up: No expense has been spared on the show which features a giant spaceship inside the venueLagerfeld's long-time muse flashed her tummy wearing a navy and gold cropped cardigan which was a modern take on a Chanel classic. She flashed the waistband of her Supreme boxers, also showing her support to the latest Louis Vuitton collaboration, whose show will feature later on in the day. Modelling sport luxe, she wore a pair of white tracksuit pants, lengthening her legs with a pair of heels. 







Lagerfeld's long-time muse: Cara (left) flashed her tummy wearing a navy and gold cropped cardigan which was a modern take on a Chanel classic, while Rita dazzled in her number (right) 











Glittering: Rita flashed a hint of skin in a plunging metallic top which had a velvet embellished panel at the front and completed her look with a pair of black trousers which had leather sections going down the front







All the little things: Rita even wore a pair of mini CC earrings as she showed her support for the high-end fashion houseHer eyes were hidden behind a pair of Chanel frames and she wore a smattering of necklaces for added glamour. Likewise, singer Rita Ora, 26, let her hair do the talking, flaunting her mane which was blow-dried to perfection. She flashed a hint of skin in a plunging metallic top  which had a velvet embellished panel at the front and completed her look with a pair of black trousers which had leather sections going down the front. Carrying a mini green Chanel bag on her shoulder, the pop of colour drew in the eye and she wore a pair of strappy heels which were decorated in Chanel's signature chainlink. 







Out of this world: Models sported clean lines and monochrome colours with silver glittered boots











Metallic moment: A number of model sported astronaut printed dresses, silver accessorises and trademark Chanel beading







Mixing it up: A model sports a boucle colourful tweed suit down the catwalk while another stuns in all white



We have lift-off: Spectators saw the branded rocket take off as models paraded the latest collection at the showLily Allen, 31, pulled off a rather regal look wearing an all-black ensemble which contrasted heavily with her platinum blonde locks. Her jacket held a very theatrical shape with puff-sleeves which she teamed with velvet wide-legged trousers and T-bar heels. She proudly clutched her quilted handbag in front of her body as she posed for a series of snaps. 



Mother and daughter: They were in good company on the day as Chanel model and actress Vanessa Paradis (left) was joined by her child with Johnny Depp, Lily-Rose (right)











Showing off her sporty side: Lily wore striped tracksuit bottoms with strappy sandals as she flashed her washboard stomach with a zipped cardigan (left and right) as her mother kept it low-key in jeans (centre) 



Close: The similarity between the two stunning ladies was striking as they posed for pictures together They were in good company on the day as Chanel model and actress Vanessa Paradis was joined by her daughter with Johnny Depp,  Lily-Rose. Lily wore striped tracksuit bottoms with strappy sandals as she flashed her washboard stomach with a zipped cardigan. Her mother kept it casual in grey jeans as they posed for pictures together.Lottie Moss wore a pink lingerie inspired dress with black suede ankle booties.Model Alice Dellal wore head-to-toe leather, while US Editor-in-Chief Anna Wintour nailed the monochrome theme, as musician Pharrell Williams continued with the sports luxe theme. 



Ready for bed: Lottie Moss wore a pink lingerie inspired dress with black suede ankle booties 











All stars: (L-R) Model Alice Dellal wore head-to-toe leather, while US Editor-in-Chief Anna Wintour nailed the monochrome theme, as musician Pharrell Williams continued with the sports luxe theme

title: 'Haters will say it's photoshopped': Kim Kardashian posts tongue-in-cheek Snapchat photo of hourglass figure
content:
Kim Kardashian posted a Snapchat picture on Monday of her hourglass figure, which seemed cartoonishly exaggerated. 'Haters will say it's photoshopped' she quipped in the caption of the photo in which she showed off her svelte legs.Her wide hips and impossibly trim waistline were thrown into relief, and she'd lifted both her hands to adjust her black baseball cap in the clearly edited shot.



Nothing to see here: Kim Kardashian posted a Snapchat picture on Monday of her hourglass figure, which seemed cartoonishly exaggeratedThe brim of the cap obscured her eyes, and her generously endowed cleavage bulged over the sloping neckline of her blue and black sleeveless jumpsuit.She'd been spotted in New York City that day filming her cameo in the forthcoming Ocean's Trilogy spin-off Ocean's Eight.The 36-year-old had flung a lavish cream fur coat over a white dress sheer enough to offer quite the view at her legs and nude underwear.



Very little to the imagination: She'd been spotted in New York City that day filming her cameo in the forthcoming Ocean's Trilogy spin-off Ocean's EightKardashian will be playing herself as the victim of a jewel heist that takes place at a fictionalized version of the famously celebrity-crammed annual Met Gala.She'd been seen in the same outfit in January while filming a red carpet scene alongside her silver-clad younger half-sister Kendall Jenner.This is rather a game acting choice for Kardashian to make, inasmuch as she'd found herself at the business end of a real and shocking theft in Paris last October.



Family business: She'd been seen in the same outfit in January while filming a red carpet scene alongside her silver-clad younger half-sister Kendall JennerOver $10 million worth of jewelry, including Mrs. Kanye West's $4 million engagement ring, was seized from the reality star during the heist in l'Hexagone.Its perpetrators bound their victim at gunpoint while plundering her luxuriant suite at the Hôtel De Pourtalès in the 8th arrondissement.Directed by Gary Ross, Ocean's Eight - due for release next June - stars Sandra Bullock, Cate Blanchett, Helena Bonham Carter, Mindy Kaling, Anne Hathaway, Rihanna, Sarah Paulson and Awkwafina, among others. 



Art imitating life: Kardashian will be playing herself as the victim of a jewel heist that takes place at a fictionalized version of the famously celebrity-crammed annual Met Gala

The Gary Ross-directed movie features a star-studded female cast including A-list actresses such as Rihanna, Sandra Bullock, Cate Blanchett, Helena Bonham Carter, Sarah Paulson, Anne Hathaway and Mindy Kaling.The all-female spin-off of George Clooney's Ocean's Eleven centres around the eight women's plan to execute a heist in New York, spearheaded by leading lady Sandra. Zayn Malik is also set to appear in the predominantly female film. In fact, Zayn was reportedly eyed for a role in 'Ocean's Eight' after his Met Gala appearance in 2016.The 24-year-old singer was approached for the movie as producers feared Kim would drop out after she was robbed at gunpoint in Paris last October.



Zayn is also set to appear in the film as producers asked the former One Direction star in case Kim backed out because of her actual jewelry-heist incident in Paris back in October



Kim will still be in it! The reality star did end up filming her scenes and will star in the film despite something similar happening in her personal life



Behind the scenes! The mega star was spotted behind the scenes on set as her scene was being set up



Long day! The newly-minuted movie star was seen leaving set after a long day of filming in sweatpants and running shoes



 Done for the day! title: Here comes Heidi! Klum looks set to make a cameo appearance in Ocean's Eight as she's pictured on set
content:
There is already an impressive line up for this summer's all female Ocean's Eight film.And it looks like Heidi Klum might be the latest recruit, as the 43-year-old model and TV personality was pictured on set of the movie in Los Angeles on Monday.The incredible cast already boats Rihanna, Sandra Bullock, Cate Blanchett, Helena Bonham Carter, Sarah Paulson, Anne Hathaway and Mindy Kaling.



Ready for her close up: Heidi Klum was spotted on the location of set of Ocean's Eight as filming switched from the streets of New York to the streets of Los Angeles on Monday The all-female spin-off of George Clooney's Ocean's Eleven centers around the eight women's plan to execute a heist in New York, spearheaded by leading lady Sandra. The film is set for release in Summer 2018 and will be distributed worldwide by Warner Bros. And now it looks like the famous model is set to make a cameo appearance along with a whole host of other celebrities.  



Natural beauty: The 43-year-old model and TV host flashed some cleavage in a bohemian maxi dress with a black lace hem and wore her long honey blonde hair loose



Supporting role: Heidi is the latest famous face to have a cameo in the all-female heist movie that stars Sandra Bullock, Cate Blanchett, Helena Bonham Carter and Anne Hathaway



In character: Once cameras started rolling, Heidi was seen wearing a skimpy red dress with white heels Another cameo appearance will come from late night chat show host James Corden.The Kardashian clan are also getting involved with Kim Kardashian West, Kylie Jenner and Kendall Jenner making appearances.Victoria Secret angel Adriana Lima, pop star Zayn Malik, model Hailey Baldwin and Vogue editor-in-chief Anna Wintour will also appear in the anticipated drama.







Ready to work: Earlier it seemed she was in need of a pick me up and carried a cup of coffee as she arrived for filming



Heidi shaded her eyes from the harsh California sun with a pair of gold-framed aviator-style sunglasses



Stylish outfit: Heidi stepped out in a pair of chunky black heels and carried a black purse over one shoulderOscar-nominated filmmaker Gary Ross is directing from a screenplay he wrote with Olivia Milch, and Steven Soderbergh and Jon Kilik is producing.  Heidi Klum looked ready for action as she was pictured on the set of Ocean's Eight.She wore a floral maxi dress and a boyfriend style blazer as she added a pair of chunky black heels and a little black handbag to complete her look. Her golden blonde tresses were styled in soft curls as she parted her hair directly down the middle.The American Idol judge wore a pair of silver shades as she held a to-go coffee cup. 



Had company: The famous model had quite an entourage to escort her to where she needed to be

title: 'We were 9 and 10 years old!': Kim Kardashian shares rare carefree photo with sister Kourtney from her happy childhood long before fame hit
content:
So often Kim Kardashian is posed like a princess in training in her flashback photos from her childhood.But on Sunday the Keeping Up With The Kardashians star shared a rare relaxed snap as she stood with her sister Kourtney as well as two pals from Calabasas.The caption read: 'Throwback to when Kourtney & I were 9&10. Not sure what's cooler Allison's LA Raiders boxers worn as shorts or Kourt's Reebok pumps & hair cut and me doing a hair flip per usual.'



The early years: Kim Kardashian shared a flashback photo with sister Kourtney and some pals on Instagram over thw weekendKim, now 36, is seen laughing with her head tilted up.Kourtney, now 37, is laughing as she holds onto her friend.This comes just before the wife of Kanye West - as well as Kourtney - both shared a photo with from a mini getaway in Palm Springs.



Tripping together: Kourtney, Kim and Khloe documented their road trip on social media 



Nice ride: It was a classic two-tone, cherry red and white Chevrolet Bel Air with two doors, white wall tires and bench seats in the front and backBefore setting to the open road, the Keeping Up With the Kardashians stars enjoyed a nice brunch where Kourtney.In a Snapchat clip, Kim shared a photo of her hot chocolate/The words were 'Hot Koko' typed across the screen. 



Classic ride: Kourtney, Khloe and Kim took to their Snap accounts on Sunday to share first-person accounts of their day cruising around California



Hot rod: Khloe's account had the most action from the day, seen here in the driver's seatKhloe, 32, got the honors of driving the beautiful piece of machinery while Kourtney posted a video to Khloe's account of them riding three deep across the front seat.

It was a classic two-tone, cherry red and white Chevrolet Bel Air with two doors, white wall tires and bench seats in the front and back. The three of them had a great time riding on a relatively clear highway, past wind turbines and sprawling greenery.







Filling up: Before setting to the open road, the Keeping Up With the Kardashians stars enjoyed a nice brunch where Kourtney, 37, sat stirring a drink and Kim, 36, shared a photo of her hot chocolate, with the words 'Hot Koko' typed across the screen



How'd she do that? She then explained that Kourtney had been driving, and not well in her opinion, but had pulled over to change outfits







Open road: The three of them had a great time riding on a relatively clear highway, past wind turbines and sprawling greenery



Check her out: Kim posted mostly filtered selfie videos to her Snap account







Selfie Queen: Kim rode in the middle seat on the bench and also took selfies once they switched into the other vehicle




Kim posted mostly filtered selfie videos to her Snap account after the day of fun was over.When they were joy riding, she rode in the middle seat on the bench and shared one nice image of the car they were driving around in.Khloe's account had the most action from the day. After they swapped out of the vintage ride, the moved on to another vehicle where Kourtney drove, and Khloe was not happy about it.



Sisterly love: After they swapped out of the vintage ride, the moved on to another vehicle where Kourtney drove, and Khloe was not happy about it'She's the worst driver ever and she just keeps taking her clothes off in the backseat,' Khloe said.She then explained that Kourtney had been driving, and not well in her opinion, but had pulled over to change outfits.  'She pulled over to change out of jeans into sweats,' she added, with a filter on her face. 'Not a good driver.'



Not a fan: 'She's the worst driver ever and she just keeps taking her clothes off in the backseat,' Khloe said of Kourtney's driving and side of the road antics



That explains it: 'She pulled over to change out of jeans into sweats,' she added, with a filter on her face; 'Not a good driver,' she saidKourtney then appeared at the driver side door and propped her leg up so Khloe's followers could see her DKNY sweatpants, which fit her very loosely. 'My outfit is killing it, I know,' Kourtney said. She was wearing a denim jacket with the collar popped featuring a large letter 'K' stitched on the chest on one side.To that, Khloe replied, 'Killing it and your'e killing me, smalls! Drive the f**king car. Drive!' To that, apparently Kourtney started driving and they made their way off.



So stylish! Kourtney then appeared at the driver side door and propped her leg up so Khloe's followers could see her DKNY sweatpants, which fit her very looselyKim must have been feeling in a nostalgic mood that day as she took to Instagram to post another throwback photo.In the picture she's posing alongside her older sister Kourtney who is sporting a cowboy hat and awkward grin.She captioned the photo: 'I'm into throwbacks these days. I'm 19 & cowgirl Kourt is 20.' 



Throwback Monday! Kim captioned the photo: 'I'm into throwbacks these days. I'm 19 & cowgirl Kourt is 20'

title: Sorry Emma, but you haven’t done yourself or feminism any favors this week, you’ve just made a right t*t of yourself
content:
‘I really don’t know what my t*ts have to do with it,’ exclaimed an exasperated Emma Watson this week.‘It’s very confusing. I’m quietly stunned.’The Harry Potter star was responding to widespread criticism of her decision, as Hollywood’s most vocal young feminist, to pose topless for Vanity Fair magazine.‘Feminism is about giving women choice,’ she explained. ‘It is not a stick with which to beat other women. It’s about freedom, it’s about liberation, it’s about equality. They were saying I couldn’t be a feminist and have boobs.’Well, Emma, that would indeed be very confusing, I agree.



‘I really don’t know what my t*ts have to do with it,’ exclaimed an exasperated Emma Watson this week

But that wasn’t what the critics were actually saying.It’s probably a given that the vast majority of feminists, unless they are men identifying as feminists, have boobs.No, Emma, it wasn’t you flashing your boobs as a feminist that caused all the raised eyebrows.The problem is that you haven’t always had this attitude to feminism and boob-flashing.In 2013, Beyoncé released her self-titled album which included a spoken word recording from the novelist Chimamanda Ngozi Adichie, taken from her TED speech We Should All Be Feminists.The album was accompanied by provocative videos showing Beyoncé in various states of undress.Many lauded it as ‘fierce feminism’ at its ferocious best.Others were less impressed.‘As I was watching, I felt very conflicted,’ said one female critic. ‘I felt her (Beyoncé’s) message felt very conflicted in the sense that on the one hand she is putting herself in a category of feminist, but then the camera, it felt very male, such a voyeuristic experience of her.’Wow.That sounds like precisely the kind of feminist that Emma Watson would deplore: a woman using feminism as ‘as stick with which to beat other women.’Only, it WAS Emma Watson, in an interview for Wonderland magazine.Yes, the self-styled global standard-bearer for feminism had decided that Beyoncé’s brand of feminism was not the right brand of feminism.Why?Because, to deploy the parlance of Donald Trump’s notorious locker room, Emma felt it was incompatible for Beyoncé to claim to be a feminist when she was effectively getting her t*ts out for the lads.Hmmm.This brings us back to Emma’s new photo shoot for Vanity Fair.It was no accident that she chose to take off her clothes and parade topless under a skimpy white crocheted bolero jacket.



Emma knew exactly what she was doing with this Vanity Fair shoot - she's been posing since she was 14 and removing her bra for a shoot the first time is of course deliberate




She knew exactly what she was doing.After all, she’s a woman who’s been posing for magazine cover shoots since she was 14 years old.So when Emma removed her bra for the first time like this, she was doing it very deliberately.‘It felt incredibly artistic,’ she said this week, ‘and I’m thrilled with how interesting and beautiful the photographs were.’Of course she was, that’s what all actresses say when they strip naked to promote themselves and their movies.Though they tend to take a much dimmer view of women who pose as topless Page 3 girls in British tabloids. That, they sneer, is ‘demeaning to women.’Under normal circumstances, I wouldn’t disagree with Emma’s assessment; the photos are inarguably interesting and beautiful.But how does exposing her breasts to the world fit with Emma’s condemnation of Beyoncé doing the same?A generous observer might say ‘uneasily’.A less generous observer would brand it flaming hypocrisy.I don’t want to be too harsh on Emma Watson, not least because she is still young and should be allowed to evolve her views as she ages.She’s also in many ways a very impressive young lady – an excellent actress who conducts admirable work as a United Nations ambassador.



By posing for Vanity Fair, Emma exposed herself to some as a feminist fraudIn interviews, she comes across as intelligent and thoughtful, and she clearly cares passionately about this issue.But by posing for this Vanity Fair photo, she exposed not just her breasts.She also exposed herself to some as a feminist fraud; someone who professes to want other women to have the ‘freedom and liberation’ to decide how they behave as feminists, but who actually wants to dictate to them how they behave as feminists.Beyoncé flashing her flesh to sell an album in the name of feminism dismayed Emma, because she feared it would simply serve to titillate men.Yet she sees no conflict in doing the same thing herself, while promoting, with almost comical inappropriateness, the new Disney kids movie Beauty And The Beast.We live in an age when the debate about feminism, women’s rights and sexism rightly rages hard, and men, as I know only too well, tip their toe into the fire at their peril.But on the general principle, it shouldn’t be difficult to find consensus.For instance, I agree whole-heartedly with Emma Watson’s own overview: ‘Fighting for women’s rights has too often become synonymous with man-hating. This has to stop. For the record, feminism is the belief that men and women should have equal rights and opportunities. It is the theory of the political, economic and social equality of the sexes.’She’s absolutely right. But other female celebrities don’t seem to have got the memo.Every time Madonna rants and raves at a women’s march about blowing up Donald Trump, the cause of feminism is damaged.Just as it is when Kim Kardashian posts another bird-flipping topless selfie, supposedly in the name of ‘female empowerment’.Or, as happened at a Welsh university in Britain this week, when students are told that they can’t use words like ‘mankind’ or ‘sportsmanship’ any more because they are ‘gender-offensive.’None of this nonsense helps anyone, particularly when there are far more important battles to fight.




This weekend, a Polish politician actually said in the European parliament during a debate on the gender pay gap, that ‘women must earn less than men, because they are weaker, they are smaller, they are less intelligent’.Now THAT is outrageous sexism and if there’s a march to get this despicable misogynist dinosaur sacked, count me in.But let’s also have some rational perspective to counter the more rabid, headline-grabbing brand of feminism.Right now, the five most powerful people in Emma Watson’s home country are all women: Her Majesty, Queen Elizabeth II; Prime Minister, Theresa May; Scottish First Minister, Nicola Sturgeon; Home Secretary, Amber Rudd; and Metropolitan Police Commander, Cressida Dick.With the exception of the Queen – who has turned out to be arguably the most successful Monarch of all time - they all got there strictly on merit.As Oprah Winfrey put it so perfectly: ‘Excellence is the best deterrent to racism and sexism.’

title: Louis Tomlinson fans 'send airport bust-up girl 2,000 online threats making her too scared to leave her house'
content:
The woman involved in an airport bust up with Louis Tomlinson has been sent 2,000 abusive online messages from his fans, according to reports.Ana Becerra, 22, was pulled to the floor by the One Direction star as he was defending his girlfriend, Eleanor Calder. Trolls have also set up fake social media profiles in her name, including a Twitter account that has discussed Louis. 








Pulled apart: Ana Becerra claims she is the girl in grey thrown to the ground during a fight with 1D star Louis Tomlinson (centre in blue) and his girlfriend Eleanor in LAX on Friday



Fury: The singer looks back at Miss Becerra after the fight as she gesticulates at him before saying she would press charges







War of words: Ana Becerra, 22, has accused Louis of hitting her after she pulled out her phone to film his row with a photographer taking pictures of his 24-year-old girlfriend Eleanor Calder at Los Angeles Airport



'Socked': Miss Becerra says she was left with a cut face and claims she was hit in the stomach and was vomiting two hours after the fight with Louis and his partner, who had landed at LAX after a break in Las Vegas.











An account claiming to belong to Ana Becerra says that Louis could have killed her - but she is facing abuse from others who claim she 'started' it by trying to film his row with a photographerA friend of Ms Becerra told The Sun's James Beal: 'Ana and her family have received more than 2,000 threatening messages on social media and she’s trying to find a decent lawyer.'It comes after a Twitter account claiming to be owned by Ms Becerra said she 'could have died' from a brain haemorrhage.    Doubts have been cast on whether the Twitter account actually belongs to Ms Becerra or if it was set up by a troll. The 22-year-old has accused Louis of punching her after she pulled out her phone to film his row with a photographer taking pictures of his 24-year-old girlfriend Eleanor Calder at Los Angeles Airport.Miss Becerra says she was left with a cut face and was hit in the stomach during the fight with Louis and his partner, who had landed at LAX on Friday after a break in Las Vegas.In the face of threats and abuse from his supporters the account claiming to be her tweeted claims that Louis was an inadequate father, he has been unfaithful and has smoked cannabis, adding: 'And now he beats women'.Astonishing footage of the fight has appeared online and the hashtag #WeSupportLouis is trending among his fans who say he and Eleanor are the real victims, with one witness telling MailOnline Louis' girlfriend was hit in the face and throat by a gang of girls.Tomlinson, who is said to be worth £40million, recently rekindled his romance with Miss Calder after an on-off relationship from several years ago.
